1. What is the definition of modulation index (MI) where ‘Ar’ is reference signal amplitude and ‘Ac’ is carrier signal amplitude, then modulation index (MI) is

explanations.b: Explanation 2: By definition, the modulation index (MI) is defined as the ratio of the amplitude of the carrier signal (A<sub>c</sub>) to the amplitude of reference signal (A<sub>r</sub>).

questions.question: 2. What is output voltage when switch “S<sub>1</sub>” and “S<sub>3</sub>” are “ON”

explanations.a: Explanation 1: When S<sub>1</sub> and S<sub>3</sub> are turned ON simultaneously, the load terminals are shorted and hence the output voltage is zero.

explanations.b: Explanation 2: Inverter converts DC input supply into AC.
